name: noaction
objective: Check that positioning the pointer over an Application icon does nothing
description: When the mouse pointer is simply laid over an application tile (icon+name on grid) without any click, nothing must happen (cursor is not changed, app icon is not highlighted).
pre_condition:
- switch to Home mode
- have some favourite apps on desktop

steps.description: move the mouse pointer over an application tile

author: root

name: singleclick
objective: Check that a single click highlights the application idon
description:
A single click over an icon must not change the mouse cursor. 
The application icon must be in highlighted state after this action.
pre_condition:
- switch to Home mode
- have some favourite apps on desktop

steps.description: move the mouse pointer over an application tile then single click on the icon

author: root

name: clickmove
objective: Check that a hold single click then a drag moves the application icon
description:
When a single click is done and hold on an applictaion icon then the cursor should change to "grab state" (TODO: to be determined. Could be a small hand)
The application icon should be highlighted in this state.
Then moving the pointer while holding the mouse button down should drag the icon on screen.
pre_condition:
- switch to Home mode
- have some favourite apps on desktop

steps.description: click on a favourite application icon on the desktop and drag the icon (click and hold left mouse button)
steps.expected: the icon moves on the desktop, following the cursor pointer moves

author: root

name: clickmoverelease
objective: Check that an icon position can be changed
description:
After dragging an icon to a new position and releasing the mouse button, the icon should occupy the nearest tile with the following rules:
- to occupy a tile, the icon must overlap more than 50% of its final position in the target tile at release time.
- if the icon overlaps less than 50% of the target zone, then it must slide back to its original position
- if the move is not possible (tile already occupied, or no tile), then the icon must slide back to its original position
pre_condition:
- switch to Home mode
- have some favourite apps on desktop

steps.description: click on a favourite application icon on the desktop and drag the icon (click and hold left mouse button) then release the button
steps.expected: the app icon must have moved to its final destination

author: root
